name: METOPROLOL TARTRATE

ingredients.name: SODIUM STARCH GLYCOLATE TYPE A POTATO

indications.text: metoprolol tartrate beta-adrenergic blocker indicated treatment : hypertension , lower blood pressure . lowering blood pressure reduces risk fatal non-fatal cardiovascular events , primarily strokes myocardial infarctions . ( 1.1 ) angina pectoris . ( 1.2 ) myocardial infarction , reduce risk cardiovascular mortality used conjunction intravenous metoprolol therapy patients definite suspected acute myocardial infarction hemodynamically stable patients . ( 1.3 )

contraindications.text: administer daily food meal . titrate weekly longer intervals needed tolerated . ( 2 ) hypertension : recommended starting 100 mg daily , single divided doses . ( 2.1 ) angina pectoris : recommended starting 100 mg daily , given two divided doses . ( 2.2 ) myocardial infarction : starting depends upon tolerance intravenous metoprolol , full prescribing information . ( 2.3 )

warningsAndPrecautions: 100 mg tablets film-coated , pink colored , round , biconvex tablets debossed r 100 one side scored side . ndc 71335-9716-1 : 30 tablets bottle ndc 71335-9716-2 : 100 tablets bottle ndc 71335-9716-3 : 60 tablets bottle ndc 71335-9716-4 : 90 tablets bottle ndc 71335-9716-5 : 180 tablets bottle store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) . adverseReactions: metoprolol tartrate contraindicated severe bradycardia , second third degree heart block , cardiogenic shock , systolic blood pressure < 100 , decompensated heart failure , sick sinus syndrome ( unless permanent pacemaker place ) , patients hypersensitive component product .
indications_original: Metoprolol tartrate is a beta-adrenergic blocker indicated for the treatment of: Hypertension, to lower blood pressure. Lowering blood pressure reduces the risk of fatal and non-fatal cardiovascular events, primarily strokes and myocardial infarctions. ( 1.1 ) Angina Pectoris. ( 1.2 ) Myocardial Infarction, to reduce the risk of cardiovascular mortality when used in conjunction with intravenous metoprolol therapy in patients with definite or suspected acute myocardial infarction in hemodynamically stable patients. ( 1.3 )
contraindications_original: Administer once daily with food or after a meal. Titrate at weekly or longer intervals as needed and tolerated. ( 2 ) Hypertension: Recommended starting dosage is 100 mg daily, in single or divided doses. ( 2.1 ) Angina Pectoris: Recommended starting dosage is 100 mg daily, given as two divided doses. ( 2.2 ) Myocardial Infarction: The starting dosage depends upon tolerance of intravenous metoprolol, see full prescribing information. ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
The 100 mg tablets are film-coated, pink colored, round, biconvex tablets debossed with R 100 on one side and scored on the other side.
                  
                     NDC 71335-9716-1: 30 Tablets in a BOTTLE
                     NDC 71335-9716-2: 100 Tablets in a BOTTLE
                     NDC 71335-9716-3: 60 Tablets in a BOTTLE
                     NDC 71335-9716-4: 90 Tablets in a BOTTLE
                     NDC 71335-9716-5: 180 Tablets in a BOTTLE
                  
                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature.]
                  Protect from moisture.
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP using a child-resistant closure.
                  Repackaged/Relabeled by:Bryant Ranch Prepack, Inc.Burbank, CA 91504
adverseReactions_original: Metoprolol tartrate is contraindicated in severe bradycardia, second or third degree heart block, cardiogenic shock, systolic blood pressure <100, decompensated heart failure, sick sinus syndrome (unless a permanent pacemaker is in place), and in patients who are hypersensitive to any component of this product.
